response.summary:
Civil Engineer specialized in water resources projects, with a focus on H&H modeling, stream reconnaissance,
pumped storage, land development, and water treatment, as well as field experience surveying sites and
managing work sites. I'm interested in designing stream restorations, water quality monitoring, stormwater
management, and water distribution systems.
response.skills: SAP2000, Team Leadership, Forklift Operation, ArcMap, Autodesk Civil 3D, Particle Size Analysis, Water Sampling, sediment sampling, Water Testing, Water Resource Engineering, Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Office, ArcGIS Products, Laboratory Skills, Stormwater, Water Quality, Water Treatment, Solid Waste, AutoCAD

profile_positions.description:
•Analized Land Cover (LC) variation of the Catalpa Creek Watershed, between 2001-2019 using ArcMap and Excel to account for the LC gains and losses, concluding that 8% of the land has experienced LC change.
•Performed a geomorphic classification, concluding that 82% of the creeks are degraded by leading a crew of three engineers to survey the bathymetry of the Creeks in Starkville, MS, and analyzing obtained data with ArcGIS, Civil 3D and Microsoft Excel.
•Collect 70 sediment samples to perform wet sieving and laser diffraction sizing.
•Determined nutrient losses by sampling runoff from 64 acres of agricultural fields and performing laboratory water quality analysis (phosphorus, nitrogen, and solids analysis) on over 300 collected samples in accordance with EPA standards.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Worker

company.name: WSP USA
company.description:
At WSP USA, our expertise lies at the intersection of the infrastructure and the skylines we have helped to shape from coast to coast.

We can meet your needs with cross-disciplinary services across multiple sectors and markets including: advisory; buildings; water and environment; energy; and transportation & infrastructure.

Our professionals have planned, designed and managed the construction of some of the most iconic high-rise buildings, bridges, highways, tunnels and transit and rail systems across the United States. Some of our most notable projects include major expansions of the New York and Los Angeles transit systems, as well as iconic buildings such as One World Trade Center and 432 Park Avenue in New York City, the Salesforce Tower in San Francisco, and the U.S. Coast Guard Headquarters in Washington, D.C.
